remarks: The size of the set of closed walks of length p, p prime, is divisible by p.  This corresponds to statement 9 in [Huneke] p. 2:  "It follows that, if p is a prime number, then the number of closed walks of length p is divisible by p", see also ~ clwlkndivn .  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 7-Oct-2018.)
statement: numclwwlk8 $p |- ( ( V USGrph E /\ V e. Fin /\ P e. Prime ) -> ( ( # ` ( ( V ClWWalksN E ) ` P ) ) mod P ) = 0 ) $.
